info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 5:47AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Hancock, southeastern Henderson, Warren, southeastern Rock Island, McDonough, eastern Mercer, southern Whiteside, Henry, western Bureau and southeastern Scott Counties through 645 AM CDT... At 546 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Geneseo to Colchester. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Geneseo around 550 AM CDT. Atkinson around 555 AM CDT. Good Hope around 600 AM CDT. Bardolph and Hooppole around 605 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include New Philadelphia, Bushnell, Little Swan Lake, Tampico, Prairie City and Deer Grove. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 3 and 5. Interstate 80 in Iowa near mile marker 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 52. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 33. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 15, near mile marker 29, and between mile markers 36 and 44. Interstate 280 between mile markers 8 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
